post_text: This won't fix everything, but it's a start. It’s not only ICE and CBP, but an endless list of federal agencies that are currently able to weaponize your private data. It's past time for Congress to get serious about ending our privacy dystopia. I'll be at it until we do.

The U.S. needs to update the antiquated Privacy Act of 1970 (which only applies to the federal government, not private businesses from which the government can buy information), and institute something comparable to the GDPR. It also needs to end the 3rd-party doctrine to uphold the 4th Amendment.
